title: Pretty much all mages feel like either burst mages or DPS mages
body:
*note: this is not a buff mages thread, some need buffs and some need nerfs*

Outside of competitive, a lot of (with a few outliers like maybe orianna) mages are played purely because of their damage in an all in, which is either DPS or burst

{{champion:101}} ? His poke is secondary, he's meta because he's the only poke AP with a EWQ burst combo comparable to Jayce or lethality Varus. 

{{champion:34}} ? QE burst and R DPS. Her CC and wall is nice but not the *main* reason she's played. Just buy a ton of damage items and one-shot the ADC

{{champion:115}} Okay he's partly played for his tower taking ability but not for his poke. He deals huge AOE DPS in an engage, and is a generally good teamfighter

{{champion:112}} is just a burst mage with no identity anymore, he should be played for his stun, ult zoning, and maybe his shield in tandem with his good damage but all he does these days is walk up to the carry and EWQR

{{champion:99}} LuX SuppOrt iS pLAYEd fOR heR shIElD

{{champion:61}} Probably one of the only champions to be played because of her ult being game changing CC, and having a good shield

{{champion:4}} Actually surprisingly has avoided this as well because he's focused on early game roams rather than teamfights. Also is among the few to have point and click CC


And this would be Okay in a vacuum, but that leaves champions who have this stuff as their main shtick being relatively useless

{{champion:136}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:30}} ({{champion:8}} maybe) Why play these champions when you can play another champion that takes 1 second longer to shred a tank, but in exchange has better CC, (unless you need ryze point and click very badly) burst, utility, and more

{{champion:134}} {{champion:45}} {{champion:63}} cool your bigger numbers overkilled the ADC by 1000 damage, but meanwhile the enemy mage overkilled the ADC by 100 and is continuing to contribute with good poke, lower ult reliance, CC, zoning, and utility

Sometimes a champion has such a good secondary niche that they're meta
{{champion:268}} {{champion:103}} are mainly damage oriented like above but they have stuff like mobility, CC for picks, play making ability, etc that lets them compete with other mages

{{champion:127}} {{champion:163}} pay for their utility with decreased damage more than the meta mages and in turn manage to stay out of meta


This is probably because of LoL slowly becoming a highly team fight and engage oriented game, with sustain and poke taking the back seat (rip poke>engage>sustain>poke triangle) to keep things exciting but I'd really prefer if playing less damage focused mage was an in between of a supportive role and carry role rather than just being second fiddle backup to the ADC when they can't go in safely compared to a longer range mage

Edit: someone can probably steal my content and repost this because I made the mistake of posting in a low-traffic hour (which means it has less upvotes per hour and won't make it to front page)

Mages and ADCs are Carries, meaning they focus on dealing dmg.
What other dmg types are there besides DPS and Burst?

You're going to see the same type of diversity among mages as you see among ADCs

Carry simply means gold or EXP reliant. They don't need to deal damage. Here's some examples of non DPS/burst ways of contributing to a team, while still relying on gold or levels for bigger numbers:

Poke damage (which is different from DPS in that you don't kill them over 10 seconds in a teamfight but make them back over a minute before a teamfight)

Health advantage through healing/shielding (R.I.P Soraka mid maybe arcane comet or Aery will give her back the oomph she needs. Vladimir and to a lesser extent viktor can do this)

Damage to objectives (Ziggs, pretty much. Though a champion that deals extra damage to rift, Baron, dragon, inhibs and/or scuttle crab would be interesting)

Heavily level dependent CC, or CC that is only useful when an ally is nearby (Anivia)

There's an un filled niche for a carry mage who has a Nami E/Sona Q/Vladimir R/Zoe E and is focused heavily on enhancing ally damage with their own.

Even then there should be supportive mages who aren't outright enchanters, Zyra after all is classified as a 'catcher' instead of a battlemage.

Carry in this context is a role not a subjective definition for how much you carry a team
ADC -> AD carry
APC -> AP carry

THAT kind of carry

Oookay then mages shouldn't be only AP carries.

When I said carry, again I meant 'where you funnel resources such as gold into', a good Alistar or Braum can 'carry' in the sense you're talking about

I think the issue with the way you define it is its a flawed premise. You can funnel gold and exp into anyone you'd like to but they may not carry. 
Its true you can carry without doing the most damage in a game. Carries tend to poke and sustain until you can find a target to go all in on and that's where they attempt to land their combos.
A good support can easily carry through locking down enemy carries and preventing them from doing damage. It doesnt matter how strong your carry is if the enemy carry doesn't get any damage off.
In that sense mages are not only carrying through damage. A good example is an orianna ulti. If im playing Ori and im behind I know my ult can turn a teamfight if landed properly even if the damage is negligible. Its true damage wins games but enabling/preventing damage wins games by proxy and it can be just as obvious as that ADC unloading.

I agree with this though, what I'm saying is that non dedicated burst/DPS mages should be more about winning games by proxy but instead they're about one shotting the ADC and each other, with this being a secondary (but still very huge) advantage. Xerath can stop the enemy carry from going in by making them low with Q poke but in soloqueue he's picked pretty much because EWQ can outright kill them anyway from a range.

It's definitely a large amount because solo queue teams are disorganized compared to competitive (making the deathball 5v5 team too easy and good), but it's also partly because of numbers such as how squishy/tanky each champion is, where damage is distributed in kits, and because even in competitive teamfight comps are easier to pull off than other types.
I don't think mages can be classified as anything else
Yeah, funnel your resources into Nunu, he's a carry {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Carry does not simply mean gold or exp reliant.
A carry is someone who deals damage required to win the game whether it be to towers (ADCs primarily) or champs (ADCs or Mages)
The rest of a team protects or targets carries because stopping their damage output even at the cost of dying will turn a teamfight.

There should be ways of being valuable to the team without being teamfight engage damage only. An all in should only compose a small part of the game, and carries should be able to win objectives through zoning, sieging, poking and splitpushing (okay maybe not splitpushing unless you have a global TP ADC TF/Shen-like Marksman), all of which can be done with the above methods.

Despite not sounding fun, attrition through poke and sustain should be a viable option to keep the game from being a one dimensional deathmatch.

I had something long typed out but I got like, halfway through it, and then realized it was pointless to be so redundant.

I disagree.

Xerath, Ziggs, Viktor, Orianna, Twisted Fate, Aurelion Sol, Cassiopeia, Vladimir, Brand, Ahri, and Taliyah are all fine. They have unique kits and playstyles, and they each bring something special to the game. I cannot agree with a thread complaining about these champions.

The rest of them I guess might be in need of some changes, but still... If you're going to complain about mages, don't just list nearly every mage. It makes your stance appear really biased and hard to relate to.
Almost every champion you're saying is unused was massively used in pro games for a long time.
